title: SK Sigma Olomouc
text:
SK Sigma Olomouc is a <a href="Czech%20Republic">Czech</a> <a href="association%20football">football</a> club from the city of <a href="Olomouc">Olomouc</a>. The club currently plays in the <a href="Czech%20First%20League">Czech First League</a>, the first tier of Czech football. The club played in the first tier league for 30 years between 1984 and 2014, winning the <a href="Czech%20Cup">Czech Cup</a> and <a href="Czech%20Supercup">Czech Supercup</a> in 2012. Being relegated to <a href="Czech%20National%20Football%20League">Czech National Football League</a> in 2014, the club won the league the subsequent season and got a promotion back to First League in 2015, but failed to stay in the top division and were relegated after only one season.
History.
The club was founded as FK Hejčín Olomouc in 1919, playing in the national top league for the first time in the <a href="1982%E2%80%9383%20Czechoslovak%20First%20League">1982–83 season</a> as Sigma ZTS Olomouc. The club next played in the <a href="Czechoslovak%20First%20League">Czechoslovak First League</a> in the 1984–85 season, remaining in the top level of football for the rest of the Czechoslovak era. Olomouc reached the quarterfinals of the <a href="1991%E2%80%9392%20UEFA%20Cup">1991–92 UEFA Cup</a>, their best result in the competition. In the following season's competition, the club beat Turkish side <a href="Fenerbah%C3%A7e%20S.K.">Fenerbahçe</a> 7–1 in the second leg of their second round tie and 7–2 on aggregate, before going out of the competition at the hands of Italian team <a href="Juventus%20F.C.">Juventus</a>.
The club qualified to play European football in 1996 after finishing as runners-up in the <a href="1995%E2%80%9396%20Czech%20First%20League">1995–96 Czech First League</a>.
Olomouc finished fourth in the <a href="1998%E2%80%9399%20Czech%20First%20League">1998–99 Czech First League</a>, again qualifying for European competition. The club was fined 5,000 <a href="Swiss%20franc">Swiss franc</a>s in October 1999 for racist chanting in a UEFA Cup match against <a href="RCD%20Mallorca">Real Mallorca</a>'s black players.
In August 2011, the club was fined 4 million <a href="Czech%20koruna">Czech koruna</a> and deducted nine points as a result of a corruption enquiry by the <a href="Football%20Association%20of%20the%20Czech%20Republic">Football Association of the Czech Republic</a>. Olomouc won the <a href="Czech%20Cup">Czech Cup</a> that season, but were banned by UEFA from competing in the subsequent <a href="UEFA%20Europa%20League">UEFA Europa League</a> due to the corruption sanctions. In 2014 the club finished 15th in the league, resulting in their relegation after 30 years in the top level of competition.
